numbered_ace_sentences: 1. A legacy applicant is an applicant.
2. A legacy applicant has a family member who attended the school.
3. I noticed that being a legacy applicant increases the chance of admission.
4. I noticed that this increase is larger than the increase for a non-legacy applicant.
5. I wonder why a small dip in the graph exists near the 90th percentile.
6. I will be the second person in my family who goes to college.
9. I do not have the legacy advantage.
10. This lack of advantage will hurt my chance of admission.
11. The title is: The Apple Doesn't Fall Far From The Tree.
